title: Bike Ride, Javvadhu Hills
brief: The Javadhu Hills are an extension of the Eastern Ghats spread across parts of Vellore and Tiruvannamalai districts in the northern part of the state of Tamil Nadu in southeastern India

title: Bike Ride, Nilgiris, Kokkal
brief: The Nilgiris District is in the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu. Nilgiri (English: Blue Mountains) is the name given to a range of mountains spread across the borders among the states of Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Kerala

title: Bike Ride, Sholar Dam to Athirapalli Falls
brief: At a distance of 31 Kms from Athirapally & 45 Kms from Valparai, Sholayar Dam is a beautiful dam situated on Athirapally - Valparai road. It is one of the top tourist places to visit near Athirapally Waterfalls. The Solaiyar Dam is the second largest rock dam in Asia and measures about 20 Km in length

title: Dam, Banasura Dam
brief: Banasura Sagar Dam, which impounds the Karamanathodu tributary of the Kabini River, is part of the Indian Banasurasagar Project consisting of a dam and a canal project started in 1979

title: Dam, Vaigai Dam
brief: The Vaigai Dam is built across the Vaigai River near Andipatti, in the Theni district of Tamil Nadu, southern India. It provides water for irrigation for the Madurai district and the Dindigul district as well as drinking water to Madurai and Andipatti

title: Exploring, Agamalai
brief: Agamalai village is located in India and listed under Taluk : Bodinayakkanur, ... Agamalai Agamalai is a Village in Bodinayakkanur Taluk in Theni District

title: Exploring, Dhanushkodi
brief: Dhanushkodi is an abandoned town at the south-eastern tip of Pamban Island of the state of Tamil Nadu in India. It is situated to the South-East of Pamban and is about 24 kilometres west of Talaimannar in Sri Lanka

title: Exploring, Thekkady
brief: Thekkady is the location of the Periyar National Park, which is an important tourist attraction in the Kerala state of India

title: Falls, Surali Falls
brief: Suruli falls, is located 56 km from Theni and 10 km from Cumbum in the Theni District in Tamil Nadu, India. It is a 2 stage Cascading water fall. The Suruli River supplying the falls originates from the Meghamalai mountain range

title: Inner Girivalam, Tiruvannamalai
brief: Every full moon, tens of thousands of pilgrims worship Annamalaiyar by circumambulating the Annamalai hill barefoot.[43] The circumambulation covers a distance of 14 kilometres (8.7 mi), and is referred as Girivalam

title: Mangroove Forest, Pichavaram
brief: Pichavaram is a village near Chidambaram in Cuddalore District, Tamil Nadu, India. It is located between the Vellar estuary in the north and Coleroon estuary in the south. The Vellar-Coleroon estuarine complex forms the Killai backwater and the mangroves that are permanently rooted in a few feet of water

title: Short Trek, Gingee Fort
brief: Gingee is a panchayat town in Villupuram district in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. The nearest town with a railway station is Tindivanam, 28 km away and Thiruvannamalai, 29 km. Gingee is located between three hills covering a perimeter of 3 km. Gingee is famous for its Gingee Fort, a popular tourist attraction

title: Short Trek, Kudrai Vetti & Lookout View
brief: Manjolai Hills is a lovely hill station tucked away deep in the magnificent Kalakad Mundanthurai Tiger Reserve in the Western Ghats.

title: Short Trek, Palani
brief: Palani is a town and a taluk headquarters in Dindigul district, Tamil Nadu located about 100 kilometres South-east of Coimbatore, 100 kilometres north-west of Madurai, and 67 kilometres from Kodaikanal

title: Short Trek, Vandhavasi Hills
brief: vandavasi hill temple Thavalagirinathar (shiva temple) very famous temple in this hill. Here karthigai deepam festival is very famous. people from many places

title: Sunrise, Kanyakumari
brief: Kanyakumari is a coastal town in the state of Tamil Nadu on India's southern tip. Jutting into the Laccadive Sea, the town was known as Cape Comorin during British rule and is popular for watching sunrise and sunset over the ocean

title: Trekking & Girivalam, Tiruvannamalai
brief: Every full moon, tens of thousands of pilgrims worship Annamalaiyar by circumambulating the Annamalai hill barefoot.[43] The circumambulation covers a distance of 14 kilometres (8.7 mi), and is referred as Girivalam

title: Trekking, Chikkumagaluru
brief: the headquarters of Chikkamagaluru district in the Indian state of Karnataka. Located on the foothills of the Mullayanagiri peak of the Western Ghaats, the city attracts tourists from around the state for it's pleasant

title: Trekking, Dhudsagar Falls
brief: Dudhsagar Falls is a four-tiered waterfall located on the Mandovi River in the Indian state of Goa. It is 60 km from Panaji by road and is located on the Madgaon-Belagavi rail route about 46 km east of Madgaon and 80 km south of Belagavi

title: Trekking, Gokarana
brief: Gokarna is a town on the Arabian Sea, in the southwestern Indian state of Karnataka. A popular pilgrimage destination for Hindus, it’s known for sacred sites like Mahabaleshwar Temple, which has a shrine dedicated to the deity Shiva

title: Trekking, Kaali Malai, Nagar Kovil
brief: Kalimala Durgadevi Temple, Pathukani, Kanyakumari ... The word 'Kalimala' literally means 'the mountain of Goddess Kali'

title: Trekking, Kodachadri
brief: Kodachadri is a mountain peak with dense forests in the Western Ghats in South India, 78km from Shimoga. It is declared as natural heritage site by the Karnataka Government

title: Trekking, Kolli Malai
brief: Kolli Hills or Kolli Malai is a small mountain range located in central Tamil Nadu and spreaded over the Namakkal district of India. The mountains rise to 1300m in height and cover an area of approximately 280 km

title: Trekking, Kolukkumalai
brief: Kolukkumalai tea estate trek brings forth the best adventurous times of your live here at this largest organic tea estate in the world

title: Trekking, Kudremukh
brief: Kuduremukha is a mountain range and name of a peak located in Chikkamagaluru district, in Karnataka, India. It is also the name of a small hill station cum mining town situated near the mountain, about 48 kilometres from Karkala and around 20 kilometres from Kalasa

title: Trekking, Kumara Parvatha
brief: Kumara Parvatha also known as Pushpagiri trek is said to be one of the most difficult treks in Karnataka Western Ghats

title: Trekking, Kurinjal Peak
brief: Kurinjal Peak trek near Kudremukh is one of the best nature treks in the state of Karnataka as this peak lies in the famous Kudremukh national park's craggy

title: Trekking, Monsoon, Kudremukh
brief: Kuduremukha is a mountain range and name of a peak located in Chikkamagaluru district, in Karnataka, India. It is also the name of a small hill station cum mining town situated near the mountain, about 48 kilometres from Karkala and around 20 kilometres from Kalasa

title: Trekking, Monsoon, Kumara Parvatha
brief: Kumara Parvatha also known as Pushpagiri trek is said to be one of the most difficult treks in Karnataka Western Ghats

title: Trekking, Narashima Parvatha
brief: Narasimha Parvatha is also called the Agumbe peak. It is part of the famous Agumbe Sringeri Trekking Trail

title: Trekking, Parvathamalai
brief: The height of Parvathamalai is over 4,000 feet and the distance from the base is 5.5 km. Parvatham means mountain and ‘Parvatha Malai’ as its called, signifies ‘Hill of Hills’ or ‘Queen of Hills’. Parvathamalai presents eight different shapes from eight directions around the hill

title: Trekking, Periyur and Chinoor Colony
brief: Periyur is a Village in Kodaikanal Block in Dindigul District of Tamil Nadu State, India. It is located 73 KM towards west from District head quarters Dindigul

title: Trekking, Sathuragiri
brief: Sathuragiri Hills or Chathuragiri is situated 10 km from Watrap near Srivilliputhur. The name Sathuragiri came from Chathur Veda Giri, where all the four Vedas met and formed the hill. Another meaning is that the whole mountain is in square in shape so they called by name Chathuragiri. Sathuragiri is the Abode of God

title: Trekking, Tadiandamol
brief: Tadiandamol or Thadiyandamol is the highest mountain of Kodagu district, Karnataka, India. It is the third highest peak in Karnataka. It is located Western Ghats range, and reaches an elevation of 1,748 m

title: Trekking, Tirupathi to Tirumalai
brief: Tirupathi, a famous pilgrimage place in South India. Devotees from all over India and Other Countries visit the place does Tonsure and see the image of a deity The Lord Venkateswara

title: Trekking, Vellagavi
brief: Vellagavi is a small village located in the Western Ghats of Kodaikanal. Vellagavi has no road. The village has more temples than the houses

title: Trekking, Vellagavi to Kumbakarai
brief: Vellagavi is a small village located in the Western Ghats of Kodaikanal. Vellagavi has no road. The village has more temples than the houses

title: Trekking, Velliangiri
brief: a part of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve, are situated at the Western Ghats border of Coimbatore district, Tamil Nadu bordering Palakkad District, Kerala. Known as the 'Sapthagiri, 7 Hills (Tamil: சப்தகிரி, ஏழுமலை) - Seven Mountains', these mountains are held and revered on par with spiritually most powerful place on the planet - Mount Kailash, the legendary abode of Lord Shiva.
